CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 , which is almost two orders higher than that of P1 ( the hole mobility of pure P1 film is 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 8 Such comparable high mobility is beneficial for charge transfer in the resulting PSCs. 5 For the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film ( in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , spin - coated from ODCB solutions ) , hole mobility ( μ hole ) of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and electron mobility ( μ e ) of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 were obtained. I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties. Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Using DCB as the processing solvent , four polymer solar cells with blends of PSFDTBT and PC71BM in weight ratios of 1 : 2.5 , 1 : 3 , 1 : 3.5 , and 1 : 4 , respectively , as the active layer were fabricated , and their J-V curves are shown in Figure 3a. In all cases , PCEs of about 4.1% were obtained.

Let's think step by step.

1. PSFDTBT
2. PC71BM
3. DCB solution
4. SiO2
5. Ci (capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer)
6. P1
7. ODCB solutions
8. PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| DCB solution |
| SiO2 |
| Ci (capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer) |
| P1 |
| ODCB solutions |
| PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |

| PC71BM |
| DCB solution |
| SiO2 |

The paragraph does not contain any clear references to other material names besides the ones listed above.

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 , which is almost two orders higher than that of P1 ( the hole mobility of pure P1 film is 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 8 Such comparable high mobility is beneficial for charge transfer in the resulting PSCs. 5 For the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film ( in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , spin - coated from ODCB solutions ) , hole mobility ( μ hole ) of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and electron mobility ( μ e ) of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 were obtained. I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties. Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Using DCB as the processing solvent , four polymer solar cells with blends of PSFDTBT and PC71BM in weight ratios of 1 : 2.5 , 1 : 3 , 1 : 3.5 , and 1 : 4 , respectively , as the active layer were fabricated , and their J-V curves are shown in Figure 3a. In all cases , PCEs of about 4.1% were obtained.

Let's think step by step.

1. Material Properties:
   - LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT: -3.43 eV
   - LUMO energy level of PC71BM: 4.2 eV
   - Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
   - Hole mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend film: 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
   - Electron mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend film: 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
   - Hole mobility of pure P1 film: 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1

2. Equipment and Conditions:
   - SiO2: capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer (500 nm, Ci = 7.5 nF / cm^2)
   - OFETs: organic thin film field-effect transistors
   - ITO: indium tin oxide
   - PEDOT:PSS: poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate)
   - LiF: lithium fluoride
   - Al: aluminum
   - AM1.5G: 100 mW / cm^2

3. Solvents:
   - DCB: 1,2-dichlorobenzene
   - ODCB: 1,4-dichlorobenzene

4. Other:
   - E g,opt: optical energy gap
   - HOMO: highest occupied molecular orbital
   - LUMO: lowest unoccupied molecular orbital
   - PCEs: power conversion efficiencies
   - J-V curves: current-voltage curves
   - PSCs: polymer solar cells
   - Weight ratio: ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM in the blend film
   - I: source or injector
   - V: voltage
   - G: gate
   - S: substrate or collector
   - T: temperature
   - W: channel width
   - L: channel length
   - C i: capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer
   - V T: threshold voltage
   - I SD: source-drain current
   - μ: mobility
   - V G: gate voltage
   - Figure 2: output and transfer characteristics of the spin-coated PSFDTBT films
   - Figure 3a: J-V curves of the fabricated PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend solar cells
   - Table 1: results summary of the fabricated PSFDTBT solar cells.

| Property Name |
| --- |

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties. Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Using DCB as the processing solvent , four polymer solar cells with blends of PSFDTBT and PC71BM in weight ratios of 1 : 2.5 , 1 : 3 , 1 : 3.5 , and 1 : 4 , respectively , as the active layer were fabricated , and their J-V curves are shown in Figure 3a. In all cases , PCEs of about 4.1% were obtained.

Let's think step by step.

   - E LUMO (PSFDTBT): -3.43 eV
   - E LUMO (PC71BM): 4.2 eV

2. Transport Properties:

3. Photovoltaic Properties:

   - Capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer (C i): 7.5 nF / cm^2
